source: Calculated from ISKCON Vaishnava Calendar 2025-2026 and lunar cycle patterns

ekadashis.name: Saphala Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Observing this Ekadashi brings success and prosperity in all endeavors

ekadashis.name: Pausha Putrada Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Blesses devotees with worthy children and family prosperity

ekadashis.name: Sat-tila Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Donations of sesame seeds on this day bring immense spiritual merit

ekadashis.name: Jaya Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Grants victory over material attachments and brings spiritual success

ekadashis.name: Vijaya Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Ensures victory in all challenges and obstacles in life

ekadashis.name: Amalaki Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Sacred to the Amalaki tree, grants longevity and good health

ekadashis.name: Papmochani Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Destroys all sins and purifies the soul

ekadashis.name: Kamada Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Fulfills all desires and grants liberation from material bondage

ekadashis.name: Varuthini Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Protects devotees from all calamities and negative influences

ekadashis.name: Mohini Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Named after Lord Vishnu's Mohini avatar, grants beauty and charm

ekadashis.name: Apara Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Grants limitless spiritual merit, equivalent to visiting holy places

ekadashis.name: Nirjala Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Most powerful Ekadashi - waterless fast equals observing all 24 Ekadashis

ekadashis.name: Yogini Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Removes the fear of death and grants a peaceful afterlife

ekadashis.name: Devshayani Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Marks beginning of Chaturmas, Lord Vishnu's cosmic sleep begins

ekadashis.name: Kamika Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Grants liberation and fulfills all wishes of devotees

ekadashis.name: Shravana Putrada Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Blesses devotees with children and family happiness

ekadashis.name: Aja Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Removes sins and grants moksha (liberation)

ekadashis.name: Parsva Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Sacred to Lord Vishnu's changing of sides during cosmic sleep

ekadashis.name: Indira Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Helps ancestors attain moksha, performed during Pitru Paksha

ekadashis.name: Papankusha Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Destroys all sins like a sharp weapon (ankusha)

ekadashis.name: Rama Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Sacred to Lord Rama, grants all wishes and spiritual merit

ekadashis.name: Devutthana Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Marks end of Chaturmas, Lord Vishnu awakens from cosmic sleep

ekadashis.name: Utpanna Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: The first Ekadashi created by Lord Vishnu from his own form

ekadashis.name: Mokshada Ekadashi
ekadashis.significance: Grants liberation and spiritual knowledge, also known as Gita Jayanti
